title: @Riot Are you willing to remove Hextech protobelt if it's problematic and the community asks for it?

replies.body: Of course they will, after a year or so. Like they did with devourer.

Two years and a month, to be exact.

Granted I count both Feral Flare and Devourer as the same item, since the very first iteration of Devourer was in fact a copy-pasted Feral Flare.

I was really not impressed with the dash.  As a galio player, I'd of much preferred a better dash with sacrifice to damage.  It pushes you like a foot forward.
A free dash including AP burst every 45 sec?  What could be problematic??{{champion:48}}
People go nuts over a vayne tumble here. Cause that's about the range this dash gets you.
people go nuts over vayne tumble because its on a 2 second cooldown and makes you invisible for a whole second while ulted.

If it is truely problematic, they should.

If the "community" just complains about it without the data backing up the claim, however..

They've said before that they're alright with removing/reworking the item if it turns out that it's problematic. Every Rioter I've seen who's commented on the Protobelt has said they find the item to be extremely dangerous, so it's likely we'll see prompt balancing if it's OP. 

That being said, I don't think Protobelt is as OP as people are thinking it'll be. The dash is incredibly short and doesn't go through walls. The real reason the item might be broken is how much damage it does, but if a champion is making the most of Protobelt's burst, they're putting themselves into basically melee range. I don't think it can really be exploited by anyone except its intended recipients - low-range battle mages.
